feed.title: Google Cloud: Confidential VM
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Confidential VM

entry.content:
As of June 20, 2025, Confidential VM instances using AMD SEV-SNP or Intel TDX do not support remote attestation when running the following guest OS images:
* SLES 15 SP7 * Ubuntu 25.04
To restore remote attestation, use an earlier guest OS version such as SLES 15 SP6 or Ubuntu 24.04.
entry.summary: Confidential VM instances with AMD SEV-SNP or Intel TDX do not support remote attestation for SLES 15 SP7 and Ubuntu 25.04 as of June 20, 2025. To re-enable remote attestation, please use previous versions of the operating system, such as SLES 15 SP6 or Ubuntu 24.04.
entry.title: Issue: Confidential VM remote attestation issue

entry.content:
Support for general purpose [C4D machine types](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/general-purpose-machines?utm_source=cloud_console&utm_medium=release_notes&utm_campaign=dec029572dce3d0d9991dd094856fdd9&_gl=1*1odqac9*_ga*OTY1OTE3MjM4LjE3NTA3ODgyNTg.*_ga_WH2QY8WWF5*czE3NTA4Mzg4MTkkbzE3JGcwJHQxNzUwODM4ODIwJGo1OSRsMCRoMA..#c4d_series) is now generally available, featuring:
* 5th generation AMD EPYC processors (Turin) and Google Titanium * AMD [Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV)](https://www.amd.com/en/developer/sev.html) which can encrypt the memory of the VM to protect data in-use
entry.summary: New C4D machine types with 5th generation AMD EPYC processors and Google Titanium are now generally available, offering enhanced security with AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) to protect VM memory.
entry.title: Feature: C4D machine types now available
